explanation:
To determine whether lfs_ctz_traverse violates the MISRA rule forbidding direct or indirect self-calls, the analyzer must be able to follow all call edges out of and back into lfs_ctz_traverse. The following symbols are required:

- lfs_ctz_index: direct callee of lfs_ctz_traverse; needed to see if it (transitively) calls back to lfs_ctz_traverse.
- lfs_popc: callee of lfs_ctz_index; included so the transitive call graph from lfs_ctz_index is known.
- lfs_bd_read: direct callee of lfs_ctz_traverse; needed to check whether it (transitively) leads back to lfs_ctz_traverse.
- lfs_min, lfs_aligndown, lfs_alignup: direct callees of lfs_bd_read; included to fully resolve lfs_bd_read's transitive calls.
- lfs_fromle32: direct callee of lfs_ctz_traverse; included to confirm it does not call back into lfs_ctz_traverse.
- lfs_fs_traverse_: direct caller of lfs_ctz_traverse; must be analyzed because recursion can occur if lfs_ctz_traverse (or its callees) call any function that lfs_fs_traverse_ also reaches (or if lfs_fs_traverse_ calls functions that eventually call lfs_ctz_traverse again).
- lfs_pair_isnull, lfs_tortoise_detectcycles, lfs_dir_fetch, lfs_dir_get, lfs_ctz_fromle32, lfs_tag_type3: direct callees of lfs_fs_traverse_; included so we can determine whether any of those (or their transitive callees) form a path back to lfs_ctz_traverse.

In short: include all direct callees of lfs_ctz_traverse and their callees (to trace outgoing paths), and include the direct caller lfs_fs_traverse_ and its callees (to trace possible incoming/back paths). This set is the minimal closure from the provided static call graph needed to decide whether an indirect cycle exists involving lfs_ctz_traverse.
